credit.credit-words: Music: Lewis Edson, 1782 Text: Charles Wesley, 1742
4. My God is reconciled, His pard’ning voice I hear: He owns me for His child, I can no longer fear: With confidence I now draw nigh, And “Father, Abba Father!” cry.
3. Five bleeding wounds He bears Received on Calvary; They pour effectual pray’rs, They strongly speak for me: “Forgive him, O forgive,” they cry, “Nor let that ransomed sinner die!”
